highlights: Built [Tumblr for iOS 3.0](https://itunes.apple.com/us/app/tumblr/id305343404?mt=8), a complete rewrite of Tumblrâ€™s existing iOS application and the first one build in-house.
Developed and open sourced the [Tumblr iOS SDK](https://github.com/tumblr/TMTumblrSDK).
Converted Tumblr iOS to be [completely native](http://www.theverge.com/2012/11/21/3675324/tumblr-native-app-iphone), using custom HTML rendering.
Implemented native mobile blog customization, as [profiled by The Verge](http://www.theverge.com/2014/5/6/5684212/tumblr-declares-war-on-the-internets-identity-crisis).
Released an iOS 8 share extension on day one. [Wrote about](http://bryan.io/post/97658826431/what-we-learned-building-the-tumblr-ios-share-extension) all the problems we encountered.
Lead developer of GS Research for iPad, the first native iOS application developed at Goldman Sachs. In use by approximately 10,000 institutional investment clients.
Designed and implemented UIs for research offerings on the client-facing [GS 360](http://360.gs.com) institutional portal.
Developed Java web applications and services for all phases of investment research distribution workflow, including HTML rendition generation and personalized email delivery.
Presented on topics including HTML5/CSS3, Spring IoC, and combining mobile web/native technologies.
Member of the Mobile UX Working Group, developed standards for user interface consistency across all of the firm's mobile applications
Developed a Java web application to record committee approvals of investment research target price and rating changes.
